episode_summary: This episode, recorded live in Christchurch, features discussions on New Zealand's aviation history, unique nationality laws, misidentified marine species, and World War I conspiracy theories. Guest presenter Josh Thompson joins the regular hosts to share intriguing facts and humorous anecdotes.

facts.fact: The first people to achieve powered flight were not actually the American Wright brothers, but a lone eccentric New Zealand farmer called Cranky Dick Pierce.
In the 1940s, a law was passed that meant wherever the Dutch princess stood, didn't count as a country.
The Marine snail, Litorina saxotillus, is otherwise known as the most misidentified creature in the world, having been wrongly identified as a new species over 113 times.
During World War I, a popular conspiracy theory was that German blackmailers had drawn up a list of 47,000 highly placed English perverts.
